intro: Mentha lejeuneana, commonly known as lemon mint, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, slightly lemon-scented leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves that have a serrated edge. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale blue or violet and bloom in late summer. Mentha lejeuneana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
